thread.title: Houston YouTubers sneak into skyscraper pool at Market Square Tower
thread.title_full: Houston YouTubers sneak into skyscraper pool at Market Square Tower

author: Fernando Ramirez
title: Houston YouTubers sneak into skyscraper pool at Market Square Tower
text:
Photo: Jon Shapley/Houston Chronicle Image 3 of 27 
The rooftop pool at the Market Square Tower is seen, Tuesday, Dec. 6, 2016, in Houston. ( Jon Shapley / Houston Chronicle ) 
The rooftop pool at the Market Square Tower is seen, Tuesday, Dec. 6, 2016, in Houston. ( Jon Shapley / Houston Chronicle ) Photo: Jon Shapley/Houston Chronicle Image 4 of 27 
Mark Derusse, from left, Angela Marinos, Jeff Cardinal and Bob Panico check out the rooftop pool at the Market Square Tower, Tuesday, Dec. 6, 2016, in Houston. ( Jon Shapley / Houston Chronicle ) 
Mark Derusse, from left, Angela Marinos, Jeff Cardinal and Bob Panico check out the rooftop pool at the Market Square Tower, Tuesday, Dec. 6, 2016, in Houston. ( Jon Shapley / Houston Chronicle ) Photo: Jon Shapley/Houston Chronicle Image 5 of 27 
For residents afraid of heights, Market Square Tower offers another pool -- one that's not cantilevered -- on the building's fourth-floor terrace. (Architects' rendering.) 
For residents afraid of heights, Market Square Tower offers another pool -- one that's not cantilevered -- on the building's fourth-floor terrace. (Architects' rendering.) Photo: Jackson And Ryan Image 6 of 27 Architect Guy Jackson, of the firm Jackson and Ryan, took this selfie on October 22, 2016, before the pool at Market Square Tower apartment building at 777 Preston Street was filled with water. The pool -- with a Plexiglass, cantilevered section that protrudes over the street, 500 feet in the air -- appears to be the first of its kind in the U.S. less Architect Guy Jackson, of the firm Jackson and Ryan, took this selfie on October 22, 2016, before the pool at Market Square Tower apartment building at 777 Preston Street was filled with water. Market Square Tower's sky pool, on the 42 floor of the luxury apartment complex, at 777 Preston Street, featuring a glass-bottom, infinity pool, Wednesday,Nov. 2, 2016 in Houston. ( Karen Warren / Houston Chronicle )
